title: KLM cancels six flights in Amsterdam for ground crew strike
text:
FILE PHOTO: A view of Schiphol International Airport in Amsterdam, Netherlands August 6, 2018. REUTERS/Piroschka van de Wouw/File Photo

AMSTERDAM (Reuters) - KLM, the Dutch subsidiary of Air France, cancelled six flights at Amsterdam’s Schiphol on Wednesday morning as its ground crews held a spot strike, the second this week, amid a contract dispute with the company.

The strike from 0530 GMT to 0800 GMT “is likely to lead to disruptions,” KLM said in a statement. It said affected passengers would be helped to rebook.
description: KLM, the Dutch subsidiary of Air France, cancelled six flights at Amsterdam's Schiphol on Wednesday morning as its ground crews held a spot strike, the second this week, amid a contract dispute with the company.
